greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of series-reduced labeled trees with n nodes.
comment: "Series-reduced" means that if the tree is rooted at 1, then there is no node with just a single child.
Callan points out that A002792 is an incorrect version of this sequence. - _Joerg Arndt_, Jul 01 2014
link: David Callan, A sign-reversing involution to count labeled lone-child-avoiding trees, arXiv:1406.7784 [math.CO], 2014.
formula: E.g.f.: A(x) = Sum_{n>=0} a(n+1)*x^n/n! satisfies A(x) = exp(x*A(x))/(1+x). - _Olivier Gérard_, Dec 31 2013 (edited by _Gus Wiseman_, Dec 31 2019)
mathematica: f[n_] := Sum[(-1)^(n-k)*n!/k!*Binomial[n-1, k-1]*k^(k-1), {k, n}]/n; Table[ f[n], {n, 20}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 21 2005 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = { 1/n * sum(k=1, n, (-1)^(n-k) * binomial(n,k) * (n-1)!/(k-1)! * k^(k-1) ); } \\ _Joerg Arndt_, Aug 28 2014
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jul 20 2005
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 21 2005
New name (from A002792) by _Joerg Arndt_, Aug 28 2014
